clishell

Class CliProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Dictionary<K,V>
      • java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>
        • java.util.Properties
          • clishell.CliProperties
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyGettable<java.lang.String>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>

    public class CliProperties
extends java.util.Properties
implements PropertyGettable<java.lang.String>
    Custom Extension to java.util.Properties for CliShell, supporting following enhancements:
    getProperties enhancements:

    1. Resolution of property references - the overridden getProperty methods will resolve references to other properties using the syntax: ${property-name}
    2. Two new getProperty methods: getProperty(String name, Class klass) and a variant of that taking a defaultValue parameter - can be used to return new instances of objects using values configured in the property file

    getDottedProperty enhancements:

    New flavor of "get property" methods: "getDottedProperty" A "dotted property name" is a property name comprising zero or more "components", separated by a dot ('.') character. A form of "property inheritance" is supported by applying the following rules to dotted properties:
    1. lookup property using the dotted property name and return the value if found
    2. while there exists a penultimate component (one prior to the last) of the dotted property name, remove it and look for a property value using the modified name, returning it if found
    3. return the value of the property named by the last component of the dotted property name

    Example:
    Suppose you have the following properties defined: 
           name=default value
       prod.name=prod value
       dev.name=dev value
       prod.special.name=special prod value
    Using getDottedPropertyWithInheritance(String), the following lookups and return values should be demonstrated:
    name value notes
    name default value  
    prod.name prod value  
    uat.name default value since 'uat.name' was not defined, it stripped off 'uat.' and tried just 'name'
    prod.special.thing.name special prod value stripped off 'thing.' and found the value of 'prod.special.name'
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Parameters:

      • getProperty

        public <T> T getProperty(java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.Class<T> klass)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Same as getProperty(String), except will construct and return an object of type T initialized with the property value. If the property value is null, then will return null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - could not create object of type T from property value (see nested Throwable).
        See Also:
        Properties.getProperty(String)

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - could not create object of type T from property value (see nested Throwable).
        See Also:
        Properties.getProperty(String, String)

      • getDottedPropertyWithInheritance

        public <T> T getDottedPropertyWithInheritance(java.lang.String dottedPropertyName,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> klass)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Same as getDottedPropertyWithInheritance(String), except will construct and return an object of type T initialized with the returned property value. If the property value is null, then will return null.
        Returns:
        object of specified type initialized with property value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - could not create object of type T from property value (see nested Throwable).

      • getDottedPropertyWithInheritance

        public <T> T getDottedPropertyWithInheritance(java.lang.String dottedPropertyName,
                                              T defaultValue,
                                              java.lang.Class<T> klass)
                                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Same as getDottedPropertyWithInheritance(String, String), except will construct and return an object of type T initialized with the returned property value.
        Returns:
        object of specified type initialized with property value or default value (if property value was null)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - could not create object of type T from property value or default value (see nested Throwable for details).
